Self.Wiki: Determines the parameters used for interactable prompts.

dummyPoly1.Wiki: Specify the dummy polygon ID that is the center of the bottom of the range. If there is no dummy polygib or -1 is entered, the center coordinates will be the reference.

dummyPoly2.Wiki: Used only when the range type is a capsule. Additional dummy polygon (capsule) that creates a line segment with two dummy polygons

baseHeightOffset.Wiki: How much to raise or lower the Y coordinate of the bottom (cylinder / prism)

actionGroupId.Wiki: Which action group does this action button belong to. For example, you may be able to use X action whilst hanging, but you cannot use Y action.

isInvalidForRide.Wiki: If enabled, this action will not appear whilst in the 'riding' state.

isGrayoutForRide.Wiki: If enabled, this action will be grayed out whilst in the 'riding' state.

drawLine.Wiki: If enabled, a line will appear from the icon to the ground.

textId.Wiki: The FMG Entry ID to display.

invalidFlag.Wiki: If the event flag is ON, then this action will not appear.

grayoutFlag.Wiki: If the event flag is ON, then this action will be grayed out.

priority.Wiki: Priority when displaying multiple actions, 0 is highest priority.

execInvalidTime.Wiki: Invalid time after execution (-infinite by value)

sameCategoryActionDisplay.Wiki: Whether or not action buttons with the same category specified in the program are displayed on top of each other.

effectDispDist.Wiki: Range effect viewing distance, -1 means no range effect.

execButtonHoldSec.Wiki: When the judgment is active, if the press key is pressed for the stated number of seconds, it is considered to have been pressed. If it is 0, it is not judged to be pressed and held.

iconID.Wiki: The icon to display for the action in the world.

pointRadius.Wiki: Radius (point display range is cylindrical). -1 refers to the number of actionable ranges.

pointHeight.Wiki: Height (point display range is cylindrical). -1 refers to the number of the actionable range

pointBaseHeightOffset.Wiki: How much to raise or lower the Y coordinate of the bottom.

iconOffsetX.Wiki: The offset to apply to the icon in the world along the x-axis. Positive is right, negative is left.

iconOffsetY.Wiki: The offset to apply to the icon in the world along the y-axis. Positive is above, negative is below.

iconOffsetZ.Wiki: The offset to apply to the icon in the world along the z-axis. Positive is forward, negative is backward.

doneFlag.Wiki: The event flag to apply upon execution. -1 means no flag is set.
